dExtender
Bg Graph Status Logs Bluetooth
101 Last time we ran : Last time we got data : Last receiver time : --:--:-- --:--:-- Trend Your connection settings are turned off. "Long press" the button above
to restart
101 --
Not enough values Average --:--:-- AM 0 A1C (est.)
Service Status Account Information Raw USB Records Current BG Settings
Cloud server; Cloud Account status; Account has not been setup;
When rising; When falling; Trend alerts; Trend unknown;
Current Component Status Logs This is Settings Settings
Apply Refresh ok
Retrieve your access code Your access code from the follow app Text to Speech 'Say' your notifications Limit TTS Only speak when nearing a warning threshold Polite TTS Prefix your speech with:
"The blood glucose level is".
This is useful when using BlueTooth speakers and the beginning part of the speech gets cut off and you miss the actual BG value
Display A1C on chart This is not a final A1C value, but a calculated
 ESTIMATED value of the current average. Use this
 as a guide, but not as a definitive value.
Display moving average Displays the 60 minute moving average
 of your BG levels. This will smooth out the
 bumps and show the trend over time.
Background Image Have an image instead of a solid black background Chart Background How do you want the chart background to look Widget Background How do you want the widget background to look
SmartWatch Notifications Format notifications for SmartWatch display Warning Levels Only Notifications are only raised on warnings.
 Use this in conjunction by enabling vibrate notifications on your band.
Intro Tune Play the dExtender tune on startup Background Service Background service Link to the cloud Start/Stop receiving
from the cloud Auto stop services Automatically stop services
when data errors hit a time threshold Elapsed time before stopping service Time threshold before we automatically stop services Auto Off Alarm Tone to play when services are automatically turned off
Refresh Interval Longer intervals save battery life Smart Refresh 15 minute refresh intervals
while BG is in "safe" zone,
otherwise five(5) minutes
when limits exceeded.
Overrides refresh interval Enable Elevate Warnings Alert when your bg has NOT hit a high, but is sustained high for a period of time Trailing High Resets your high level settings when a BG is falling, to this new target value Target high level Target value not set Trailing Low Resets your low level settings when a BG is rising, to this new target value Target low level Target value not set
Enable Early Warnings Using recent trends, predict when the next reading will cross a threshold Sample Count How many samples to use to determine recent trends Look Ahead How far ahead should we look
Alert on high trend Alert when trend is up/double up Alert on low trend Alert when trend is down/double down Hard Low Alarm Sound to play when hitting a significant low Hard Low Behavior Force confirmation of the hard low alarm Low Alarm Sound to play when hitting a low BG value High Alarm Sound to play when hitting a high BG value High Alert - Critical reminder Force confirmation after a certain number of reminders High Alert - Alarm count After how many alerts do we become critical
Low Trend Alarm Sound to play when trending very low High Trend Alarm Sound to play when trending very high Vibrate Vibrate this device (if supported) Alarm in Silent Mode Play alarm even when the device is in silent mode Ignore Network Errors The network monitoring is very detailed and will generate errors on unstable networks.
You can ignore these errors
Data Error Alarm Sound to play when failing to receive data Network Error Alarm Sound to play when phone has no network access (WiFi/Cell Tower)
Service Error Alarm Sound to play when one of the service components has failed
dExtender dExtender Service is Running

dExtender
Slide to unlock
Our staff was found on the New Jersey Shore
 after Hurricane Sandy. It was sanded and
 stained with MinWax PolyShades
 
 This app was an effort by me, a dad of a
 type 1 diabetic, who is trying, with my 
 debatable smarts, lots of late nights and
 gallons of coffee, to make a difference.
 The app, web site, graphics, etc.
 were all made by me, and are copyrighted.
 
 A little about me. I'm a database guy 
 (Oracle, MySQL, Postgres, Sql Server, 
 SQLite, SQL/DS and DB2) whose worked for 
 AT&T Labs, a number of Wall Street firms, a 
 VOIP company, was a Director of Database
 Technologies, etc..
 This project, in terms of technical know how,
 has dwarfed any project I've ever worked on.
 
 I can be reached at
admin@dextender.com
 
 A special thanks to Jon 
for helping me debug some issues !!!
